contentrichtext.text: {{distinguish2|the surnames '''[[Teng (surname)|Teng]]''' ''(滕)'' or '''[[Táng (surname)|Táng]]''' ''(唐)''}} '''Deng''' ([[Chinese surname|Chinese]]) is an East Asian [[surname]]. It is a transcription of [[wikt:邓|邓]] ([[simplified Chinese character]]) or [[wikt:鄧|鄧]] ([[Traditional Chinese character|traditional]]). It is transliteted as ''Dèng'' in [[pinyin]] and Teng in [[Wade-Giles]]. In [[Yue Chinese|Cantonese]], it is ''Dahng'' in [[Yale Romanization#Cantonese|Yale]] and ''Dang6'' in [[Jyutping]]. In [[Minnan]] or [[Taiwanese Minnan|Taiwanese]], it is ''Tēng'' in [[Pe̍h-ōe-jī]]. The surname originating from the same Chinese character in [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]] is ''Đặng'' and it is one of the top ten surnames in [[Vietnam]]. The name is transliterated as ''Deung'' in [[Korean language|Korean]] but is very rare in [[Korea]]. Deng is one of the surnames of the [[Nanyang, Henan|Nanyang]], Henan [[Chinese clan#Tang hao|ancestral hall]] ({{lang|zh|南陽堂}}). In addition to spelling "Deng" used in [[mainland China]], other common Chinese spelling variations include: * '''Tang''' - Romanization based on [[Yue Chinese|Cantonese]] spelling common in [[Hong Kong]] * '''Teng''' - Romanization based on [[Wade-Giles]] transliteration of [[Standard Mandarin|Mandarin Chinese]] common spelling in [[Taiwan]] ==Notable persons with the surname Deng ({{lang|zh|邓/鄧}}) or its variants== *[[Deng Ai]], Wei general during the Three Kingdoms period *[[Kent Deng]], economic historian and writer *[[Deng Longguang]] ({{lang|zh|鄧龍光}}), Chinese general in World War II *[[Deng Ming-Dao]], Taoist author *[[Deng Shichang]], Qing Dynasty admiral *[[Deng Shiru]] ({{lang|zh|鄧石如}}), calligrapher and seal carver *[[Deng Xiaoping]], former [[Communist Party of China]] leader **[[Deng Pufang]], son of Deng Xiaoping **[[Deng Nan]], daughter of Deng Xiaoping *[[Deng Yingchao]], wife of Zhou Enlai *[[Deng Yanda]], 1895-1931, a left-wing general who tried to create a middle ground between the Chinese Communists and Chiang Kai-shek *[[Deng Yaping]], table tennis player *[[Alan Kwong-wing Tang]] ({{lang|zh|鄧光榮}}), actor and movie producer *[[Tang Wing Cheung]] ({{lang|zh|鄧永祥}}), birth name of Cantonese opera and film actor [[Sun Ma Sze Tsang]] ({{lang|zh|新馬師曾}}) *[[H. T. Teng]], Taiwanese ichthyologist *[[Teresa Teng]], Taiwanese singer *[[Si-an Deng]], a Chinese-Canadian badminton player *[[Wendi Deng]], Chinese-American businesswoman and current wife of billionaire [[Rupert Murdoch]] *[[History of the Ming Dynasty#An open market, silver, and Deng Maoqi's rebellion|Deng Maoqi]] ({{lang|zh|鄧茂七}}), leader of a tenant rebellion in [[Fujian]] at the end of the 1440s *[[Lydia Dunn, Baroness Dunn]], a [[crossbench]] [[House of Lords|British Peer]] *[[Sheren Tang]] ({{lang|zh|鄧萃雯}}), Hong Kong TVB actress *[[Lee C. Teng]], Chinese/Taiwanese scientist *[[G.E.M.]]({{lang|zh|鄧紫棋}}), HK Cantopop Singer-Songwriter *[[Jackie M. Tang]], Malaysian/Australian restaurateur ==Sudanese surname== Deng is also a common first or last name used among the tribes of [[South Sudan]], shared by the [[Dinka people|Dinkas]], [[Nuer people|Nuers]] and [[Shilluk people|Shilluks]]. It has various meanings; for instance, it means "Rain" in Dinka. The Dinkas also believe that the most powerful god, ruler of all gods, is Deng. ==External links== * [http://www.storyofdeng.comlu.com/storyofdeng.htm Story of Deng] {{DEFAULTSORT:Deng (Surname)}} [[Category:Surnames]] [[Category:Chinese-language surnames]]
